intro: Mapania flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellate liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the order Marchantiales. It is characterized by its thalloid structure, which is a flat, leaf-like body that lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. The plant reproduces through spores, which are produced in specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of the thallus. Mapania flagellaris thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in damp soil or on rocks. Its simple morphology and aquatic adaptations make it an important indicator species in certain ecological studies.
